tack verb
(SEW)
[ I or T ]
  fabrics
  (also mainly US baste) to sew with a long, loose stitch that holds two pieces of material together temporarily, before they are sewn together in a more tidy or permanent way

tack verb
(BOAT)
[ I usually + adv/prep ] (of a boat) to turn so that it is at an angle to the direction of the wind and receives the wind on its sails
